review: We've been using the Amazon Fire TV for a few months now, and while it started out great, for the last month it has become unusable. About 90% of the shows we try to watch have an unbearable high pitched screech. It's not a constant screech, it's only when people are talking.I have written to Amazon about this problem when it occurs and they have always refunded the cost of the movie.  But it's gotten to the point where it's not worth even attempting to watch something as the odds are very high that it will be unwatchable, or more accurately, unlistenable.This occurs whether we listen to the audio from our sound system or just through the TV itself.  It occurs for new movies, old movies, and Amazon produced shows. This problem has never occured from our cable, Netflix, DVD or PC hooked up to our TV. It is strictly an Amazon problem.By googling the problem I have seen that other people have also reported it, but I have yet to see a response from Amazon. We have pretty much decided to take Amazon Instant Video off of our list of media sources.I would ask for a refund on this device, but I haven't given up hope, yet, that they will fix it. It would be nice if they would acknowledge the problem and notify people when they have a fix.
author: Steven Kilner
